javadoc: The interface that all data types must implement.

methods.javadoc:
Indicates if this data-type is dynamically sized based upon DataOrganization.
@returns true if dynamically sized
methods.name: isDynamicallySized
methods.comment: Indicates if this data-type is dynamically sized based upon DataOrganization.

methods.javadoc:
Indicates if type has not yet been defined.
 Such types will always return a size of 1.
 (example: empty structure)
@return true if this type is not yet defined.
methods.name: isNotYetDefined
methods.comment:
Indicates if type has not yet been defined.
 Such types will always return a size of 1.
 (example: empty structure)

return.comment: true if this type is not yet defined.

methods.javadoc:
Gets a list of all the settingsDefinitions used by this data type.
@return a list of the settingsDefinitions used by this data type.
methods.name: getSettingsDefinitions
methods.comment: Gets a list of all the settingsDefinitions used by this data type.

return.comment: a list of the settingsDefinitions used by this data type.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the default settings for this data type.
@return the default settings for this dataType.
methods.name: getDefaultSettings
methods.comment: Gets the default settings for this data type.

return.comment: the default settings for this dataType.

methods.name: clone
methods.comment:
Returns a new instance of this DataType with its universalID and SourceArchive identity retained.
 Note: for built-in DataType's, clone and copy should have the same affect.

params.name: dtm
params.comment: the data-type manager instance whose data-organization should apply.

methods.name: copy
methods.comment:
Returns a new instance of this DataType with a new identity.
 Note: for built-in DataType's, clone and copy should have the same affect.

params.name: dtm
params.comment: the data-type manager instance whose data-organization should apply.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the categoryPath associated with this data type
@return the datatype's category path
methods.name: getCategoryPath
methods.comment: Gets the categoryPath associated with this data type

return.comment: the datatype's category path

methods.javadoc:
Returns the dataTypePath for this dataType;
@return the dataTypePath for this dataType;
methods.name: getDataTypePath
methods.comment: Returns the dataTypePath for this dataType;

return.comment: the dataTypePath for this dataType;

methods.javadoc:
@param path set the categoryPath associated with this data type
@throws DuplicateNameException
methods.name: setCategoryPath

params.name: path
params.comment: set the categoryPath associated with this data type

methods.javadoc:
Returns the DataTypeManager that is associated with this dataType.
 This association should not be used to indicate whether this DataType has been 
 resolved, but is intended to indicate whether the appropriate DataOrganization
 is being used.
methods.name: getDataTypeManager
methods.comment:
Returns the DataTypeManager that is associated with this dataType.
 This association should not be used to indicate whether this DataType has been 
 resolved, but is intended to indicate whether the appropriate DataOrganization
 is being used.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the name for referring to this data type.
@return generic name for this Data Type (i.e.: Word)
methods.name: getDisplayName
methods.comment: Gets the name for referring to this data type.

return.comment: generic name for this Data Type (i.e.: Word)

methods.javadoc: Return that name of the data type
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Return that name of the data type

methods.javadoc:
Returns the full category path name that includes this dataType's name.  If
 the category is null, then this just returns the dataType's name.
methods.name: getPathName
methods.comment:
Returns the full category path name that includes this dataType's name.  If
 the category is null, then this just returns the dataType's name.

methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Sets the name of the dataType

params.name: name
params.comment: the new name for this dataType.

throws.comment: if the given name does not form a valid name.

methods.name: setNameAndCategory
methods.comment: Sets the name and category of a dataType at the same time.

params.name: path
params.comment: the new category path.

params.name: name
params.comment: the new name

throws.comment: if a dataType already exists with that name and

methods.javadoc:
Get the mnemonic for this DataType.
@return the mnemonic for this DataType.
methods.name: getMnemonic
methods.comment: Get the mnemonic for this DataType.

return.comment: the mnemonic for this DataType.

methods.javadoc:
Get the length (number of 8-bit bytes) of this DataType.
@return the length of this DataType
methods.name: getLength
methods.comment: Get the length (number of 8-bit bytes) of this DataType.

return.comment: the length of this DataType

methods.javadoc:
Get a String briefly describing this DataType.
@return a one-liner describing this DataType.
methods.name: getDescription
methods.comment: Get a String briefly describing this DataType.

return.comment: a one-liner describing this DataType.

methods.name: setDescription
methods.comment: Sets a String briefly describing this DataType.

params.name: description
params.comment: a one-liner describing this DataType.

throws.comment: if the description is not allowed to be set for this data type.

methods.javadoc:
The getDocs method should provide a URL pointing to extended
 documentation for this DataType if it exists. A typical
 use would be to return a URL pointing to the programmers
 reference for this instruction or a page describing this
 data structure.
@return null - there is no URL documentation for this prototype.
methods.name: getDocs
methods.comment:
The getDocs method should provide a URL pointing to extended
 documentation for this DataType if it exists. A typical
 use would be to return a URL pointing to the programmers
 reference for this instruction or a page describing this
 data structure.

return.comment: null - there is no URL documentation for this prototype.

methods.name: getValue
methods.comment:
Get the data in the form of the appropriate Object for
 this DataType.

 For instance if the data type is an AddressDT, return an Address object.
                                  a Byte, return a Scalar* (maybe this should be a Byte)
                                  a Float, return a Float

params.name: buf
params.comment: the data buffer.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the settings to use.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of bytes to get the value from.

return.comment: the data Object.

methods.name: getValueClass
methods.comment: Get the Class of the value to be returned by this data type.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the relevant settings to use or null for default.

return.comment:
Class of the value to be returned by this data type or null if it can vary
 or is unspecified.  Types which correspond to a string or char array will
 return the String class.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the appropriate string to use as the default label prefix in the absence of any data.
@return the default label prefix or null if none specified.
methods.name: getDefaultLabelPrefix
methods.comment: Returns the appropriate string to use as the default label prefix in the absence of any data.

return.comment: the default label prefix or null if none specified.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the prefix to use for this datatype when an abbreviated prefix is desired.  For
 example, some data types will built a large default label, at which is is more desirable to
 have a shortened prefix.
@return the prefix to use for this datatype when an abbreviated prefix is desired.  May
         return null.
methods.name: getDefaultAbbreviatedLabelPrefix
methods.comment:
Returns the prefix to use for this datatype when an abbreviated prefix is desired.  For
 example, some data types will built a large default label, at which is is more desirable to
 have a shortened prefix.

return.comment:
the prefix to use for this datatype when an abbreviated prefix is desired.  May
         return null.

methods.name: getDefaultLabelPrefix
methods.comment: Returns the appropriate string to use as the default label prefix.

params.name: buf
params.comment: memory buffer containing the bytes.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the Settings object

params.name: options
params.comment: options for how to format the default label prefix.

return.comment: the default label prefix or null if none specified.

methods.name: getDefaultOffcutLabelPrefix
methods.comment:
Returns the appropriate string to use as the default label prefix, taking into account 
 the fact that there exists a reference to the data that references
 offcutLength bytes into this type

params.name: buf
params.comment: memory buffer containing the bytes.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the Settings object

params.name: options
params.comment: options for how to format the default label prefix.

return.comment: the default label prefix.

methods.name: getRepresentation
methods.comment: Get bytes from memory in a printable format for this type.

params.name: buf
params.comment: the data.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the settings to use for the representation.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of bytes to represent.

return.comment: the representation of the data in this format, never null.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this data type has been deleted and is no longer valid
@return true if this data type has been deleted and is no longer valid.
methods.name: isDeleted
methods.comment: Returns true if this data type has been deleted and is no longer valid

return.comment: true if this data type has been deleted and is no longer valid.

methods.name: isEquivalent
methods.comment:
Returns true if the given dataType is equivalent to this dataType.  The
 precise meaning of "equivalent" is dataType dependent.

params.name: dt
params.comment: the dataType being tested for equivalence.

return.comment: true if the if the given dataType is equivalent to this dataType.

methods.javadoc:
Notification that the given dataType's size has changed. DataTypes may need to make internal changes in response.
TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed from the public DataType interface!!
@param dt the dataType that has changed.
methods.name: dataTypeSizeChanged
methods.comment:
Notification that the given dataType's size has changed.  DataTypes may
 need to make internal changes in response.
 
 TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed 
 from the public DataType interface!!

params.name: dt
params.comment: the dataType that has changed.

methods.javadoc:
Informs this dataType that the given dataType has been deleted.
TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed from the public DataType interface!!
@param dt the dataType that has been deleted.
methods.name: dataTypeDeleted
methods.comment:
Informs this dataType that the given dataType has been deleted.
 
 TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed 
 from the public DataType interface!!

params.name: dt
params.comment: the dataType that has been deleted.

methods.javadoc:
Informs this data type that the given oldDT has been replaced with newDT
TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed from the public DataType interface!!
@param oldDt old data type @param newDt new data type
methods.name: dataTypeReplaced
methods.comment:
Informs this data type that the given oldDT has been replaced with newDT
 
 TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed 
 from the public DataType interface!!

params.name: oldDt
params.comment: old data type

params.name: newDt
params.comment: new data type

methods.javadoc:
Set the default settings for this data type.
TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed from the public DataType interface!!
@param settings the settings to be used as this dataTypes default settings.
methods.name: setDefaultSettings
methods.comment:
Set the default settings for this data type.
 
 TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed 
 from the public DataType interface!!

params.name: settings
params.comment: the settings to be used as this dataTypes default settings.

methods.javadoc:
Inform this data type that it has the given parent
TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed from the public DataType interface!!
@param dt parent data type
methods.name: addParent
methods.comment:
Inform this data type that it has the given parent
 
 TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed 
 from the public DataType interface!!

params.name: dt
params.comment: parent data type

methods.javadoc:
Remove a parent data type
TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed from the public DataType interface!!
@param dt parent data type
methods.name: removeParent
methods.comment:
Remove a parent data type
 
 TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed 
 from the public DataType interface!!

params.name: dt
params.comment: parent data type

methods.javadoc:
Informs this data type that its name has changed from the indicated old name.
TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed from the public DataType interface!!
@param dt the data type whose name changed @param oldName the data type's old name
methods.name: dataTypeNameChanged
methods.comment:
Informs this data type that its name has changed from the indicated old name.
 
 TODO: This method is reserved for internal DB use and should be removed 
 from the public DataType interface!!

params.name: dt
params.comment: the data type whose name changed

params.name: oldName
params.comment: the data type's old name

methods.javadoc: @return an array of parents of this data type
methods.name: getParents

return.comment: an array of parents of this data type

methods.javadoc:
Gets the alignment to be used when aligning this data type within another data type.
@return this data type's alignment.
methods.name: getAlignment
methods.comment: Gets the alignment to be used when aligning this data type within another data type.

return.comment: this data type's alignment.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this dataType depends on the existence of the given dataType.
 For example byte[] depends on byte.  If byte were deleted, then byte[] would
 also be deleted.
@param dt the dataType to test that this dataType depends on.
methods.name: dependsOn
methods.comment:
Returns true if this dataType depends on the existence of the given dataType.
 For example byte[] depends on byte.  If byte were deleted, then byte[] would
 also be deleted.

params.name: dt
params.comment: the dataType to test that this dataType depends on.

methods.javadoc:
Get the source archive where this type originated
@return source archive object
methods.name: getSourceArchive
methods.comment: Get the source archive where this type originated

return.comment: source archive object

methods.javadoc:
Set the source archive where this type originated
@param archive source archive object
methods.name: setSourceArchive
methods.comment: Set the source archive where this type originated

params.name: archive
params.comment: source archive object

methods.name: getLastChangeTime
methods.comment:
Get the timestamp corresponding to the last time this type was changed
 within its data type manager

return.comment: timestamp of last change within data type manager

methods.name: getLastChangeTimeInSourceArchive
methods.comment:
Get the timestamp corresponding to the last time this type was sync'd
 within its source archive

return.comment: timestamp of last sync with source archive

methods.javadoc:
Get the universal ID for this data type.  This value is intended to be a
 unique identifier across all programs and archives.  The same ID indicates 
 that two data types were originally the same one.  Keep in mind names, categories,
 and component makeup may differ and have changed since there origin.
@return data type UniversalID
methods.name: getUniversalID
methods.comment:
Get the universal ID for this data type.  This value is intended to be a
 unique identifier across all programs and archives.  The same ID indicates 
 that two data types were originally the same one.  Keep in mind names, categories,
 and component makeup may differ and have changed since there origin.

return.comment: data type UniversalID

methods.name: replaceWith
methods.comment:
For dataTypes that support change, this method replaces the internals of this dataType with
 the internals of the given dataType.  The dataTypes must be of the same "type" (i.e. structure
 can only be replacedWith  another structure.

params.name: dataType
params.comment: the dataType that contains the internals to upgrade to.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the lastChangeTime for this dataType.  Normally, this is updated automatically when
 a dataType is changed, but when committing or updating while synchronizing an archive, the 
 lastChangeTime may need to be updated externally.
@param lastChangeTime the time to use as the lastChangeTime for this dataType
methods.name: setLastChangeTime
methods.comment:
Sets the lastChangeTime for this dataType.  Normally, this is updated automatically when
 a dataType is changed, but when committing or updating while synchronizing an archive, the 
 lastChangeTime may need to be updated externally.

params.name: lastChangeTime
params.comment: the time to use as the lastChangeTime for this dataType

methods.name: setLastChangeTimeInSourceArchive
methods.comment:
Sets the lastChangeTimeInSourceArchive for this dataType. This is used by when a dataType
 change is committed back to its source archive.

params.name: lastChangeTimeInSourceArchive
params.comment: the time to use as the lastChangeTimeInSourceArchive for this dataType

methods.javadoc: Returns the DataOrganization associated with this data-type
methods.name: getDataOrganization
methods.comment: Returns the DataOrganization associated with this data-type

name: DataType
comment: The interface that all data types must implement.
